page.title: 14The Penllwyndu Public House
page.content: The Penllwyndu was originally prt of the Blaenpat Estate but together with much other property it was sold off in 1914. As a pub it was last officially licesed in 1926, although some local people say that beer was still being served there in the 1940's. In those days the beer was brewed in the back room and served in the front parlour. In July 1985 the Penllwyndu reopened with a single bar at the front leading through into a small restaurat, which due to local demand has already had to be extended so it can now seat fifty. It is open five days a week. Various bar meals are also served. The Penllwyndu is a free house serving three real ales but as it is within Cardiganshire, it is 'dry' on Sundays. Live music is provided most Thursdays. Wednesday is darts night.
